variable.description: 8 bytes if 'how' field is 0 (no ephemeris data); 104 bytes if 'how' field is non-zero (subframes 1-3 are included)

fields.name: svid
fields.description: SV ID for which this ephemeris data is (Valid Range: 1 .. 32).

fields.name: how
fields.description: Hand-Over Word of first Subframe. This is required if data is sent to the receiver. 0 indicates that no Ephemeris Data is following.

fields.name: sf1d
fields.description: Subframe 1 Words 3..10 (SF1D0..SF1D7). Present if 'how' is non-zero.

fields.name: sf2d
fields.description: Subframe 2 Words 3..10 (SF2D0..SF2D7). Present if 'how' is non-zero.

fields.name: sf3d
fields.description: Subframe 3 Words 3..10 (SF3D0..SF3D7). Present if 'how' is non-zero.

adjudication.reasoning: The extraction matches the standard u-blox protocol specification for the legacy AID-EPH message. The message structure is conditional on the 'how' field: a short form (8 bytes) used for polling or indicating no data, and a long form (104 bytes) containing the three ephemeris subframes (24 words total). All byte offsets and data types are consistent with the documented M8 receiver description.
